intro: Carlowrightia trichocarpa, commonly known as the California buckthorn, is a deciduous shrub native to the western United States. It features compound leaves with three to five elliptical leaflets, and it produces small, dark purple berries that are an important food source for birds. The plant has a woody stem with a rough, fissured bark that becomes more pronounced with age. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in chaparral and woodland habitats. Its botanical characteristics make it a notable species in ecological studies and native plant gardens.
